definition: An arrangement in which more than one gall is present at any gall location in a close aggregation
An arrangement in which more than one gall is present at any gall location in a scattered, irregularly spread pattern
An arrangement in which a single gall is present at any gall location
A composite chromatic quality composed of hue, saturation and intensity parts
notes: lots of color definitions: green, light green, brown, etc.; see PATO

definition: A color pattern in which a gall has transverse stripes of one hue or degree of saturation crossing another.
A color pattern in which a gall has vertical bars of one hue or degree of saturation crossing another
A color pattern in which a gall is marked with irregularly shaped spots or blots of a different hue or degree of saturation
A color pattern in which a gall is marked with small spots, patches, or specks of hue or degree of saturation differing from that of the background
A color pattern in which a gall has one hue or degree of saturation apically and a different hue or degree of saturation proximally and a color gradient between the two poles
A color pattern in which a gall is colored with a variegated pattern resembling marble
A color pattern in which a gall has one hue
A color pattern in which a gall has three or more hues or degrees of saturations
A color pattern in which a gall is dappled with spots, patches, or blotches of different colors
A color pattern in which a gall has two or more hues or degrees of saturation
A color pattern in which a gall is covered with reticulated lines of a different hue or degree of saturation
A color pattern in which a gall is marked with a round area of different hue or degree of saturation
A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of being clearly visible
A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of not being clearly visible
A gall structure that is knob-like, is attached externally, and which is not fed on by the gall-inducer
A gall structure wherein the gall inducer (and/or its associates) resides
An internal quality in which a larval chamber is free to roll around in a hollow chamber
An internal quality in which a larval chamber is suspended medially in the parenchyma by radiating plant fibers inside a largely hollow chamber
An internal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having an empty space or cavity within
An internal quality in which a gall has a single larval chamber for the gall-making insect
An internal quality in which the tissue is reminiscent of pith
An internal quality in which a gall has more than one larval chamber for the gall-making insect
An internal quality in which the larval chamber is suspended medially in firm plant tissue
An internal quality in which a larval chamber is suspended medially in sponge-like plant tissue
An internal quality in which a gall has one or multiple chambers depending on gall arrangement or additional factors
A location trait in which a gall develops on the lower or abaxial side of the leaf
exact synonyms: lower leaf gall; underside leaf gall

definition: A location trait in which a gall develops on the upper or adaxial side of the leaf
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in a branch (twigs and branches radiate from stem or trunk)
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in a bud (undeveloped shoot system)
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in cambium (under bark)
A location trait in which a gall develops on a small flower in the center of a head-type (capitulum) inflorescence
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in a fruit (acorn, including cap, for oaks)
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in an inflorescence (catkin for oaks)
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in the axil that is the space between a shoot axis and a leaf that branches from the shoot axis
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in a leaf lamina (leaf blade apical of petiole)
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in the midrib vein on a leaf
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in a petiole of a leaf
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in a lateral leaf vein (i.e., not the midrib)
A location trait in which a gall develops on the one of the ultimate segments of a compound leaf
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in a root
A location trait in which a gall develops on or in a stem (trunk; primary shoot axis of plant)
A non-cellular substance released by a cell, gland or tissue
A hairiness trait in which a gall is covered in fine, entangled hairs giving the appearance of cobweb
A hairiness trait in which a gall is covered in short, dense, fine hairs giving the appearance of felt
A hairiness trait in which a gall lacks hairs
A hairiness trait in which a gall is covered with hair or hairlike projections.
A hairiness trait in which a gall is covered with stiff or rough hairs
A hairiness trait in which a gall is minutely hispid; i.e., covered in short, stiff hairs
A plant structure not normally produced by the plant, but induced by another organism and which serves to nourish and protect the inducer
A shape trait in which a gall tapers gradually to a sharp point
A shape trait in which a gall lacks distinct morphology; irregular shape
A shape trait in which a gall resembles an ear
A shape trait in which a gall resembles a club, with the distal end of the gall distinctly expanded relative to the proximal end
A shape trait in which a gall is taller than wide and cylindrical
A shape trait in which a gall has or is marked by a curve or smoothly rounded bend
A shape trait in which a gall has a convex 3-D shape, exhibiting a consistently-sized round cross section
A shape trait in which a gall resembles a scythe or sickle
A shape trait in which a gall has a fringe or border of hairlike or fingerlike projections
A shape trait in which a gall is expanded laterally and/or opened apically
A shape trait in which a gall has a spindle-like shape that is wide in the middle and tapers at both ends
A shape trait in which a gall is shaped like a lance-head, considerably longer than wide, tapering towards the tip from below the middle; attached at the broad end
A shape trait in which a gall resembles the shape of a lentil, with convex upper and lower surfaces
A shape trait in which a gall is partly divided into a determinate number of regions
A shape trait in which a gall's surface features a small, nipple-like projection
A shape trait in which a gall has a round or lobulated protruding form, resembling a nipple
A shape trait in which a gall terminates abruptly in a little point
A shape trait in which a gall has the shape of a kidney
A shape trait in which a gall consists of two curves, in opposite directions. S-shaped
A shape trait in which a gall resembles a ball (a sphere whose equatorial diameter is equal to the polar diameter)
A shape trait in which a gall resembles a long tapered rod
A shape trait in which a gall is nearly symmetrically ovoid or elliptical
A shape trait in which a gall has three or more nearly triangular surfaces that meet apically to form a pyramid-like structure
A shape trait in which a gall is nearly, but not perfectly, spherical
A shape trait in which a gall gradually narrows or is thinner toward one end
A shape trait in which a gall is dome-shaped
A shape trait in which a gall is narrowly triangular, wider at the apex and tapering toward the base
A shedability trait in which a gall detaches naturally from its location; detachable
A shedability trait in which a gall does not detach easily; integral
A shedability trait in which a gall can readily be detached from its location but it normally (in nature) stays attached; detachable
A structure quality in which the gall location is indicated by abnormal enlargement of plant tissue, not due to cell proliferation
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface is like the surface of a compact mass of grapes
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface has any number of thin filamentous extensions
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface has numerous very small circular rounded projections or protuberances
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface has he appearance and/or consistency of moss
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface has the consistency and thickness of a paper bag (thin and dry)
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface is covered in a whitish, powdery bloom
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface is irregular
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface has many wrinkles or creases
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface is covered or partially covered with scales
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface is free of roughness or irregularities
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface includes short, pointed projections
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface includes elongate, pointed projections
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface is lacking ridges, pits, rugosity or other surface structures
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface is sticky
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface is covered with warts or projections that resemble warts, resulting in a hard rough surface
An surface texture trait in which a gall's surface is marked by one or more creases in a normally smooth surface
